name: La Tortuga Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel La Tortuga was a perfect boutique hotel for our first trip to Playa Del Carmen. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We reserved a Junior Suite with a rooftop jacuzzi (which was a jacuzzi tub) and loved it. The included breakfast is more than ample and the waitstaff was wonderful. As many have mentioned, the pool is gorgeous. We would spend our mornings at Mamita's and once it got busy, we would return to the hotel and relax poolside in the shade. There is an Oxo across the street, which was convenient for purchasing snacks and water. The hotel location is near perfect; just off of 5th but right in the middle of everything. We highly recommend this hotel, you will not regret it!
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!

likes.disliked: — On occasion, no hot water in the shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was wonderful!!! It's a beautiful gem in the center of town. One block from Fifth Avenue where all the shops, restaurants and bands are located. The food at the restaurant was excellent - we ate there three out of five nights. The beach club is about a 15 minute walk which is fine because there is no erosion at that section of the beach. Try to get to the beach between 8:30 and 9:00 to reserve your chaise - fills up quickly.
reviews.title: Romantic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are definitely returning next year.
reviews.title: Amaizing experiance at La Tortuga

likes.liked: — The staff was the best , and the hotel was amaizing.

reviews.title: We come back again and again because....................
reviews.text: We just returned home from two weeks at La Tortuga in Playa del Carmen , and can not wait to go back. The hotel was excellent. We stayed in a standard room for one week and a junior sweet for the second week. Both rooms were very nice and the house keeping staff did an amaizing job keeping the rooms tidey.The junior sweet was very nice with a hot tub on the terrace. The Agora restauraunt was one of our favorites in Playa. We enjoyed a new years supper there that was absolutley amaizing. The restauraunt staff went out of there way to make everything perfect. The Hotel was perfect , the solarium was excellent for lounging out on a sunney day. With cool drinks and salads from the restauraunt it was a good way to stay cool. The swimming pool and hot tub was a nice place to hang out and meet people. There is a nice place to sit and relax on the couches and play pool or just read a book. The hotel is in a great location on 10th. It is just off 5th ave so it is quiter and still very close to all the amenities of 5th ave. We have been to Playa del Carmen before but this was the nicest hotel we have stayed at. My wife really enjoyed Spa Itza , located in the hotel wich was really convieniant. I would deffinatly stay at La Tortuga again it was perfect.

reviews.title: Fun Girls Trip
reviews.text: NWT , Canada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 7 night stay at La Tortuga. The experience leaves me almost speechless. It was perfect! We are a couple in our 30's with 3 children. We did quite a bit of research before we booked our trip. We wanted our vacation without children to be peaceful, relaxing and well...... perfect. La Tortuga provided just that. The grounds are beautiful, the staff is very professional and helpful and very knowledgable, the restaurant has excellent food. Mamitas was a nice walk from the hotel and we always managed to find chairs and shade. The beach club attracts all different kinds of people. It was fun to sit back and read my book, when I was tired of that watch people around me, when I was tired of that go for a swim. Then of course order drinks and food. What is better than a beer in Mexico on the beach? After a day at the beach La Tortuga was so nice to come back to. We can not wait to go back!!
reviews.title: It's Perfect!!!
Best Ever Holiday for Sun, Service & Chilling out at the Hotel en Beach
reviews.text: By the way, if you have a problem with something during your stay at La Tortuga, just tell them about it and they will do everything to fix it :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best place in Playa!! The nice blue pool in the beautiful gardens are so nice and relaxing. The ambiance breathes vacation and the small bar with good, affordable wines and friendly service is perfect. In the morning you can enjoy a varied breakfast in de morning sunshine in the garden at the side of the pool. On a short walking distance thrue the pittoresque streets of playa you can easily find the beach whitm whom they made good arrangements for beds in the shades/or sun, as you wish. Not to forget the jacuzzi on the balcony overviewing the gardens enjoying a good glass of wine....
reviews.title: What a great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a must go for a nice, quiet, real holiday breathtaking little paradise in playa i stead of those massive tourist machines where you are treated as a number....
reviews.title: VIva La Tortuga!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at La Tortuga. It was everything we expected and more. Our arrival was delayed from 12 Noon until Midnight, but it was no problem contacting the hotel's arranged transportation to let them know. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and address all of our needs. Breakfast was included and delicious. We spent part of each afternoon poolside with food and exotic drinks at our fingertips. The tropical breezes were delightful. Anna made some great recommendations for dinner tailored to our liking. The bed was extremely comfortable and the cleaning staff did a better job than most of the pricier hotels we have stayed in. Definitely a fine place to get away from the winter cold and relax and feel renewed. We loved everything about Playa and will be making this an annual trip for sure!
reviews.title: Good but not perfect

likes.liked: — The pool area, daily cleaning of room, reception at arrival and the swim up room
likes.disliked: — The spa, the clueless staff and the distance to the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed here with two gal pals in April over the Easter holiday. The breakfast here is amazing! The rooms were comfortable and very clean. The pool was so much fun and the lounge area was inviting and relaxing. They do not allow children which makes for a more serene experience. I felt very "at home" here. I enjoy Playa but it was a loud weekend because of the holiday which made retreating to Hotel Tortuga in the evening all the better. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I would easily stay here again and recommend it to anyone who wants a kid free environment.
reviews.title: Fun Unique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked with La Tortuga for one night on our way to Chetmul from Cancun. We loved the hotel and Playa de Carmen so much that we cut the end of our vacation in Chetmul short so we could spend another 3 nights at La Tortuga! The staff were all amazing and genuinely nice. The rooms were super clean with amazing large showers that have the best water pressure. We will always make this our hotel in Playa de Carmen from now on.
reviews.title: Perfect little hotel with the perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just had one of the most incredible facials I've ever experienced. The facilities are stunning and the service was absolutely amazing - from the receptionist to the beauty therapist - everyone was wonderful. The spa is tucked away like a secret garden in the centre of this hotel and Mosquito Blue (an adjoining hotel that shares the spa) - great location right in the heart of 5th Avenue, but a perfect escape from how busy 5th Avenue is. I'm not staying at the hotel so I cannot comment on the rooms, but the spa is certainly worth visiting while in Playa del Carmen, whether you're a guest or not!
reviews.title: Amazing Facial at the Spa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked 2 rooms for 4 nights at this lovely hotel and did not regret it! it is very charming and personable. the staff knew us and what great customer service! it's 2 blocks from the beach. the hotel has access to mamita's beach which is beatiful (there's a waterfall in the bathroom)! we had a terrace on the 2nd floor with a jacuzzi and there was a bed with table and chairs outside our room. my only complaint with this hotel is that it's close to coco bongo and if you're a light sleeper, you can hear the drunk people outside on a saturday night. otherwise, it is amazing and would come back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: awesome boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to see what it was like to stay in the Playa del Carmen before heading to our all inclusive compound up the coast, so we picked this great hotel. The hotel is like an oasis in the city. Once inside you have no idea 5th Avenue is only steps away. It's the best of both worlds. The room was nice, staff fantastic and the setting very tropical. We visited both affiliated beach clubs and enjoyed Sensi a little more. We'll stay at La Tortuga again when enjoying the heart of Playa.
reviews.title: Great stay in Playa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from sun'fun to snow n'shovel! Stayed at this lovely hotel Feb 17 thru 23rd and for two people that like to experience diffferent people, places and things...this place (as well as PDC) makes you want to turn into a repeat visitor again and again!
reviews.title: Magnífico!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our last stay at PDC was our first in the "all-inclusive" realm (Playacar Palace) and although we had a great time and enjoyed the Palace and the "mindlessness" of an all-inclusive [and I mean that in a relaxing nice way :-) ] my heart is with La Toutuga and experiencing local flavors as the way to go.
reviews.title: Ditch the Hiltons, Sheratons, Carltons !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, staff and facility was excellent. As repeated on this site over and over - the staff are great. Friendly, communicative and very hard working. I have to tell you, some of them are working 12 plus hour days - and they continue to smile. Believe me, we travel a lot - and the little touches like making efforts to open doors for you going in and out, always saying "hello"; "how was your day?", smiling while they are sweeping (continually in the awesome pool area!), offering services and to help...all staff members were polite and engaging - but not intrusive. It's can be a fine line - and they draw it here well at La Toutuga.
reviews.title: A well-deserved 1st place rating!

likes.liked: — Quiet, unique rooms -- spotlessly clean and well-maintained
likes.disliked: — pool water was still a bit cold in January

reviews.title: Loved La Tortuga
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 116; a superior junior suite. Spacious (sparse for furntiure - maybe one interior room chair in these rooms of great size? Just a small suggestion?). Few steps up to very large open room bath with huge tub/shower you could share with several of your closest friends. Large closet with many shelves/safe etc in this are also. Very adequate for storage. Rear door with private staircase to a rooftop jacuzzi with two large day beds - it was awesome to watch the recent lunar eclipse and stargaze at night! Certainly room in this rooftop for even a small table with chairs then you could eat, sleep and get clean under the sun and stars! Great covered patio with chairs and table and a hammock - we were right next to the restaurant outdoor seating (but enclosed by half wall and plants/solarium staircase etc) and it was still exceptionally quiet (as overall this entire hotel is).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was immaculate - and kept that way. They have a stocked small refer, not any room to store anything - so we just took out the sodas and water to make room if we needed it (left in the beer so it wouldn't skunk). I realize any hotel doesn't want you stocking your own supply - but how can you pass up liters of Sol beer for 3USD across the street at the OXOX convenience store! They provide extra large bottles of water everyday - so we only bought a few extra for toothbrushing etc.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service - A Beautiful Property with a perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Playa del Carmen for the first time in August 2007 and stayed at La Tortuga. We liked the hotel and Playa so much we went back in December 2007. Need I say more? :)
reviews.title: Paradise in Playa

likes.disliked: — Disco nearby was still playing lould music at 5am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In August we stayed in a junior suite which was very roomy and the view was spectacular! In December we thought we'd try the superior junior suite and it was definitely superior - the rooftop jacuzzi, sunning area and sitting area was like a little piece of paradise.
reviews.title: Same as what you read in trip advisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: The hotel has a lovely pool and jacuzzi with the bar a few steps away. How perfect is that? The hotel is very well maintained - everything is really clean and fresh. I could go on and on and this review would be pages long.
reviews.title: A good choice

likes.liked: — Service above average for this class of hotel.
likes.disliked: — A bit far from the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone (front desk, housekeeping, busy boys, waiters, reservations, etc.) was so accommodating and helpful. Service like that makes you feel so pampered. We had a wonderful relaxing vacation. By the way, if you want to check out the Mayan ruins, go snorkeling, go to the beach, parasailing, etc. - all of that is nearby.
reviews.title: Delightful in all ways but one!

likes.liked: — Beautiful lounge/pool area, great staff, small size
likes.disliked: — Midnight music from disco down the street

reviews.title: lovely hotel but too noisy at night
reviews.text: We look forward to staying at La Tortuga again the next time we visit Playa del Carmen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I'm SO glad I found La Tortuga. The location is fantastic - perfectly close to it all, but not too close. The room my friend and I had was exactly what we needed....nothing more, nothing less - a good value.
reviews.title: A Really Great Find - Close to Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: This place is quiet and quaint with a very friendly staff. I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Best room ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't typically write reviews, but this place is exceptional. I found it because I wanted a hotel with no kids. My room was perfect: big bed, large patio, clean, large bathroom, shower was huge! Staff was excellent and very helpful. And to boot the restaurant is Excellent (breakfast comes as part of stay). Pool is lagoon like and beautiful and encased by the rooms. I didn't go swimming but they have nice sofas to hang out by the pool, which I spent time reading books. The pool is very shaded, which I think is a plus. If you want sun, walk to the beach to swim. The restaurant being good is nice because honestly most places I ate in Playa were so so or even bad. I personally like smaller/boutique hotels. This is a smaller hotel but has the amenities of a larger one. I wouldn't even bother staying anywhere else. I booked as a package and my room was only about $45 a day. It is close to 5th Ave but if you're smart you'll spend little time on 5th.
reviews.title: Quiet/Private feeling, Very friendly service, Excellent breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Playa del Carmen, Cozumel, and Isla Mujeres... but La Tortuga hotel was DEFINITELY the best place we stayed.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean accomodations, quiet setting, very friendly staff, and an amazing breakfast included! We loved it there!!!
reviews.title: Great Place with a 5 star staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had an amazing time here, stayed for our honeymoon as part of a tour of Mexico. Luxury boutique hotel, they really spoilt us. Very helpful and professional staff, bedroom and bathroom impeccable. Very good breakfast. They even brought me a cake and some sparkling white wine when they discovered it was my birthday during our stay! Bar staff were very friendly and helpful, the best I have ever come across.
reviews.title: Loved it, can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel design is very unique and cleverly thought out, with the pool being neatly intergrated with the rest of the courtyard garden. Gives it a luxurious / spa / oasis type feel. We were really sad to leave and can't wait to return. Amazing place to relax and unwind.
reviews.title: Perfect for couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose La Tortuga from a recommendation we received from some friends along with the exceptional reviews we saw on TA. To be honest, I didn't expect the hotel to meet my expectations, but in actuality, it exceeded them. For the great location, exceptional value, and perfect service, I think this is the best hotel in Playa and will never stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Edenic gem in a charming beach town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I'll try to speak to a few our main criteria below:
reviews.title: Was a great experience, value for money, I wouldnt stay anywhere else!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleanliness - The hotel was as clean as we could have imagined. For a predominantly "outdoor" hotel with the open air hallways, restaurant, and pool, it was very clean. Maybe it was just the humidity, but we always felt like the dirty ones, not the hotel. The rooms were a great combination of modern updates with some Mexican flare. The air conditioner is unbelievable. We felt like we were walking into an ice box every night when we stepped in. (Great for me, not for Megan): Upgraded bathrooms were very comfortable. Bed is comfy too.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel - Amazing Included Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first venture outside of an all inclusive and we were not disappointed. The quaintness of this place is very calming. The people are incredibly nice and very good at reading what you may or may not be in the mood for. If being left alone is your forte then they will do so as well if you are wanting to be socially engaged. Grounds immaculate, rooms very clean, modern, and cozy. Location incredibly close and convenient to everything. Would stay here again in a heartbeat
reviews.title: Greatness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My bf and I arrived at La Tortuga on Sept 3rd and stayed til Sept 7th. We arrived early and our room was ready! =). The room was small but very pretty. It definitely felt like a boutique hotel with some modern touches. It was very clean. The bed/sheets were not very comfortable but that was what I expected for the price we paid. We weren't there most of the time so that was what we wanted.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included (from the menu, at El Bistro) every day and they were delicious. The servers were very nice, welcoming and accommodating. One day, we had an early tour planned and asked the front desk if they could have breakfast ready for us to go by 7 am (which was when the restaurant opened for breakfast). She said no which was surprising to me because I had read reviews that said that they did do that for several people staying there. She really didn't seem very friendly but everyone else was very nice. Our tour ended up being pushed back a little so we were able to get down there at 7 and ask for to go breakfasts to be ready by 7:20. We had dinner there once and it was also good. They had this green sauce that I wanted to bring back with me!
reviews.title: loved it. Great place to stay with wonderful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: The pool area was gorgeous and very jungle-like. All of the pools were very shallow though. They were perfect temperature. Overall the location of the hotel was perfect! Right in the middle of everything but not noisy from the room at all. The beaches in Playa were beautiful and very blue. We got tickets to Mamitas beach club and it was pretty crowded but very pretty. I would return! (I also left a ring in my room and they found it, but I'm waiting to hear back about how to get it back).
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pretty hotel and grounds. Staff is great. Very convenient to 5th ave. Shops and nightlife. Food at their el bistro was good. Room was very nice. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Grat place to stay!!

aka: La Tortuga Hotel Playa Del Carmen
description: La Tortuga Hotel & Spa, two blocks from the beach and just around the corner from 5th Avenue. Air conditioning, Cable TV, telephone, fan, private bath or shower, bathroom amenity kit, safety box, hair dryer, coffee maker,minibar. Junior Suites and Superior Junior suites feature a Jacuzzi indoors or Rooftop, bath robes, slippers, flat screen tv. Spa services, Pool bar, happy hour, wifi, onsite restaurant El Bistro, solarium, meeting facilities,ice machine, water treadmill.
